column4: is there a simple way of editing which daemons to autostart with ubuntu(like portmap and inetd) or do I have to edit the init.d files manually?
i'll just have to search harder.
i can't understand why almost 500 mb of my memory i used..
how much RAM do you have?
then that's normal. Linux aggressively caches.
that's how much reclaiming memory you have. 311 seems plenty.
my is key - you've compiled it specifically for your hardware. Imagine trying to do that for a wide expanse of hardware matrices
yeah, i know. just an idea..
would be nice tho if one could make an own kernel in expert-mode.
I don't believe that belongs in the installer, however. After one completes the installation, that's a perfectly good choice to begin with.
I've placed a simple config at http://www.trilug.org/~crimsun/asound.conf ; if you have additional questions, /join #alsa and we'll discuss it there.
